org.tiian.lixa.xta

Class TransactionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tiian.lixa.xta.TransactionManager

  • public class TransactionManager
extends java.lang.Object
    TransactionManager class provides the factory to create Transaction objects. During its initialization, LIXA configurations for the underlying C libraries are loaded.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TransactionManager()
      Create a new object calling the native interface

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Transaction createTransaction()
      Create a new Transaction object associated with the current Transaction Manager.
      void delete()
      This method is a public interface for object finalization: it's helpful to avoid useless open connection between the Java application and the LIXA state server, especially for web services that create a new TransactionManager instance for every client call.
      protected void finalize()
      Release the C native object when finalization is executed

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TransactionManager

        public TransactionManager()
                   throws XtaException
        Create a new object calling the native interface
        Throws:
        XtaException - if the underlying native C function returns an error condition

    • Method Detail

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
        Release the C native object when finalization is executed
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object

      • createTransaction

        public Transaction createTransaction()
                              throws XtaException
        Create a new Transaction object associated with the current Transaction Manager. It calls the native C interface and it's the factory for Transacton objects.
        Throws:
        XtaException - if the underlying native C function returns an error condition

      • delete

        public void delete()
        This method is a public interface for object finalization: it's helpful to avoid useless open connection between the Java application and the LIXA state server, especially for web services that create a new TransactionManager instance for every client call.
